title: Antonio King Green charged with first degree murder in Flint quadruple shooting that left one dead
content:
FLINT, MI -- Antonio King Green has been charged with first degree murder for his role in a quadruple shooting on Saturday, May 25, that left one dead.
Police say Green turned himself in voluntarily Tuesday, May 28.
Green has also been charged with three counts of assault with intent to murder, felony firearms and carrying a concealed weapon.
The shooting, which occurred around 2:15 p.m. Saturday, May 25, near the 1100 block of West Paterson between Lawndale and Proctor avenues, resulted in the death of 20-year-old Darnisha Oaks on Sunday, May 26.
Three others involved in the shooting had been taken to Hurley Medical Center Saturday. One was listed in critical condition while two others were last listed in serious condition.
